> [helium](#comment_2_1Pv5CdXMDJm5k5iAp4SVbutnMg2ue8e58p): It's good for getting a different text layout at the screen, when not redirecting ls output to a file. The difference is visible, if You compare the console outputs of  [...]

Just tiniest difference from $ ls -1, isn't it??

> [helium](#comment_2_1Pv5CdXMDJm5k5iAp4SVbutnMg2ue8e58p): It's good for getting a different text layout at the screen, when not redirecting ls output to a file. The difference is visible, if You compare the console outputs of  [...]

Try this one: ls -1 | egrep -f <(ls -1 | sed '0~2 s/.*/\$/')

> [helium](#comment_4_1Pv5CdXMDJm5k5iAp4SVbutnMg2ue8e58p): Than You for the reply and thank You for the interesting example.I guess, different people do have different ways to process text :-D

$ ls -lhtra | cat
